creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Mr and Mrs Makiji Hase
description: tall, narrow rock with two groups of fungus growing on rock; inscription in upper half at R; very long and narrow scroll; L scroll
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, and Seals

UR: [ 圍家皆老松/蓊欝經千載/風雨捲雲涛/疑身在龍背//糾綬紫雲凝/頭頭出芝草/巍然見逸姿/宛是商山老//xx甲戌七月 ] (My house is completely surrounded by pines / Flourishing and extending in every direction. / In wind and rain like waves of rolling clouds, / I wonder - am I riding the back of a dragon? // Twisting ribbons of congealed purple clouds - / The fungus of the immortals! / I loftily watch these untrammeled forms, / Which are like the greybeards of Mount Shang.) (SA)
markings: marks: Japanese inscription outer side when rolled; seals: URC, oval intaglio: [ □君] {…shi}; upper center, square intaglio: [  紀林 ] {Kirin}; upper center, square intaglio: [ 方南] [Hōnan};
object_name: Hanging scroll, one of a pair
signed: upper center: [ 信天翁詩畫 ] {Shinten’ō shiga }
title: Rock [left of a pair of Pine and Rock]
